text: - Oh, darling.

Is this a good time
to have a little chat
about the sessions yesterday?
- Yeah.

- I just have some feedback
from Becca.
- Okay, sure.

- So she said she's
absolutely made a decision

not to have
biological children, right?

- Right.
- Right?
and when she shared with me
what you were saying,
she didn't really feel heard.
As a retreat leader,

I'm always having
to fix communication problems
between healers and guests.
- So in my session with Becca,

I actually just wanted
to give her some loving...

- Yeah.
- Feminine, nurturing energy.

And the word "faith"
just kept coming to me.
And then I asked her,

was there at any point
before your child was born,

that you didn't have faith
that this child would be born?

- Mm.
- She said yes.

- Mm.
- Many times.

So I said, "It's a big part
of your work, is faith.

There's a lot of preaching
of faith."
- Yes.

- "But a lack of embodiment
of the faith."

- But that's
not what's happening here.
Like, it's got nothing to do

with how we think
they're going,
what they think it--

it's just that
in those moments--
- So hang on a second.

I want to go right
to that point.
When we question people,

it's always gonna feel like
it's a trigger

and it's, like--feel like
you're not being heard.

She got a little triggered
about the word "faith,"

and called me
a con artist healer.

To someone who's
a strong, religious pastor,
the work that we do is voodoo.

But what came through
is what came through

and my duty as a healer
is--is to give that message.
- No, no, no.
It's more of a delicate process
than you think.

- But I have to be authentic
to the healer I am
that has to put that faith in.
Faith challenges.

I need Chrissie to trust me
and respect me as a healer

and with my work
in order to heal.

- Would you agree that,
you know, as a healer,

it's important that the client
feels understood or heard?
- Absolutely.

- Yeah, well,
that's the bottom line.

Feeling understood
is the most important thing.

Just giving you
some tough love.
